1 /*global signals:false, window:false*/
  2 
  3 /*!!
  4  * Hasher <http://github.com/millermedeiros/hasher>
  5  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://millermedeiros.com>
  6  * @version 0.9.92+ (2011/06/18 05:52 PM)
  7  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
  8  */
  9 
 10 /**
 11  * Hasher
 12  * @namespace History Manager for rich-media applications.
 13  * @name hasher
 14  */
 15 var hasher = (function(window){
 16     
 17     //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18     // Private Vars
 19     //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20     
 21     var 
 22         
 23         // local storage for brevity and better compression --------------------------------
 24         //==================================================================================
 25         
 26         hasher,
 27         document = window.document,
 28         location = window.location,
 29         history = window.history,
 30         Signal = signals.Signal,
 31         
 32         
 33         // local vars ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 34         //==================================================================================
 35         
 36         /** @private {string} previous/current hash value */
 37         _hash, 
 38         
 39         /** @private {number} stores setInterval reference (used to check if hash changed on non-standard browsers) */
 40         _checkInterval,
 41         
 42         /** @private {boolean} If hasher is active and should listen to changes on the window location hash */
 43         _isActive,
 44         
 45         /** @private {Element} iframe used for IE <= 7 */
 46         _frame,
 47         
 48         
 49         // sniffing/feature detection -------------------------------------------------------
 50         //===================================================================================
 51         
 52         /** @private {boolean} if is IE */
 53         _isIE = (!+"\v1"), //hack based on this: http://webreflection.blogspot.com/2009/01/32-bytes-to-know-if-your-browser-is-ie.html
 54         
 55         /** @private {boolean} If browser supports the `hashchange` event - FF3.6+, IE8+, Chrome 5+, Safari 5+ */
 56         _isHashChangeSupported = ('onhashchange' in window),
 57         
 58         /** @private {boolean} if is IE <= 7 */
 59         _isLegacyIE = _isIE && !_isHashChangeSupported, //check if is IE6-7 since hash change is only supported on IE8+ and changing hash value on IE6-7 doesn't generate history record.
 60         
 61         /** @private {boolean} If it is a local file */
 62         _isLocal = (location.protocol === 'file:');
 63     
 64     
 65     //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 66     // Private Methods
 67     //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 68     
 69     /**
 70      * Remove `hasher.prependHash` and `hasher.appendHash` from hashValue
 71      * @param {(string|null)} [hash]    Hash value
 72      * @return {string}
 73      * @private
 74      */
 75     function _trimHash(hash){
 76         hash = hash || '';
 77         var regexp = new RegExp('^\\'+ hasher.prependHash +'|\\'+ hasher.appendHash +'$', 'g'); //match appendHash and prependHash
 78         return hash.replace(regexp, '');
 79     }
 80     
 81     /**
 82      * Get hash value stored inside iframe
 83      * - used for IE <= 7. [HACK] 
 84      * @return {string} Hash value without '#'.
 85      * @private
 86      */
 87     function _getFrameHash(){
 88         return (_frame)? _frame.contentWindow.frameHash : null;
 89     }
 90     
 91     /**
 92      * Update iframe content, generating a history record and saving current hash/title on IE <= 7. [HACK]
 93      * - based on Really Simple History, SWFAddress and YUI.history solutions.
 94      * @param {(string|null)} hashValue Hash value without '#'.
 95      * @private
 96      */
 97     function _updateFrame(hashValue){
 98         if(_frame && hashValue != _getFrameHash()){
 99             var frameDoc = _frame.contentWindow.document;
100             frameDoc.open();
101             frameDoc.write('<html><head><title>' + hasher.getTitle() + '</title><script type="text/javascript">var frameHash="' + hashValue + '";</script></head><body> </body></html>'); //stores current hash inside iframe.
102             frameDoc.close();
103         }
104     }
105     
106     /**
107      * Stores new hash value and dispatch change event if hasher is "active".
108      * @param {string} newHash  New Hash Value.
109      * @private
110      */
111     function _registerChange(newHash){
112         newHash = decodeURIComponent(newHash); //fix IE8 while offline
113         if(_hash != newHash){
114             var oldHash = _hash;
115             _hash = newHash; //should come before event dispatch to make sure user can get proper value inside event handler
116             if(_isLegacyIE){
117                 _updateFrame(newHash);
118             }
119             hasher.changed.dispatch(_trimHash(newHash), _trimHash(oldHash));
120         }
121     }
122     
123     /**
124      * Creates iframe used to record history state on IE <= 7. [HACK]
125      * @private
126      */
127     function _createFrame(){
128         _frame = document.createElement('iframe');
129         _frame.src = 'about:blank';
130         _frame.style.display = 'none';
131         document.body.appendChild(_frame);
132     }
133     
134     /**
135      * Get hash value from current URL
136      * @return {string} Hash value without '#'.
137      * @private
138      */
139     function _getWindowHash(){
140         //parsed full URL instead of getting location.hash because Firefox decode hash value (and all the other browsers don't)
141         //also because of IE8 bug with hash query in local file [issue #6]
142         var result = /#(.*)$/.exec( hasher.getURL() );
143         return (result && result[1])? decodeURIComponent(result[1]) : '';
144     }
145     
146     /**
147      * Checks if hash/history state has changed
148      * @private
149      */
150     function _checkHistory(){
151         var curHash = _getWindowHash();
152         if(curHash != _hash){
153             _registerChange(curHash);
154         }
155     }
156     
157     /**
158      * Check if browser history state has changed on IE <= 7. [HACK]
159      * - used since IE 6,7 doesn't generates new history record on hashchange.
160      * @private
161      */
162     function _checkHistoryLegacyIE(){
163         var windowHash = _getWindowHash(),
164             frameHash = _trimHash(_getFrameHash());
165         if(frameHash != _hash && frameHash != windowHash){ //detect changes made pressing browser history buttons. Workaround since history.back() and history.forward() doesn't update hash value on IE6/7 but updates content of the iframe.
166             hasher.setHash(frameHash);
167         }else if(windowHash != _hash){ //detect if hash changed (manually or using setHash)
168             _registerChange(windowHash);
169         }
170     }
171     
172     /**
173     * Adds DOM Event Listener
174     * @param {Element} elm Element.
175     * @param {string} eType Event type.
176     * @param {Function} fn Listener function.
177     * @private
178     */
179     function _addListener(elm, eType, fn){
180         if(elm.addEventListener){
181             elm.addEventListener(eType, fn, false);
182         }else if(elm.attachEvent){
183             elm.attachEvent('on' + eType, fn);
184         }
185     }
186     
187     /**
188     * Removes DOM Event Listener
189     * @param {Element} elm Element.
190     * @param {string} eType Event type.
191     * @param {Function} fn Listener function.
192     * @private
193     */
194     function _removeListener(elm, eType, fn){
195         if(elm.removeEventListener){
196             elm.removeEventListener(eType, fn, false);
197         }else if(elm.detachEvent){
198             elm.detachEvent('on' + eType, fn);
199         }
200     }
201     
202     //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
203     // Public (API)
204     //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
205     
206     hasher = /** @lends hasher */ {
207     
208         /**
209          * hasher Version Number
210          * @type string
211          * @constant
212          */
213         VERSION : '0.9.92+',
214         
215         /**
216          * String that should always be added to the end of Hash value.
217          * <ul>
218          * <li>default value: '';</li>
219          * <li>will be automatically removed from `hasher.getHash()`</li>
220          * <li>avoid conflicts with elements that contain ID equal to hash value;</li>
221          * </ul>
222          * @type string
223          */
224         appendHash : '',
225         
226         /**
227          * String that should always be added to the beginning of Hash value.
228          * <ul>
229          * <li>default value: '/';</li>
230          * <li>will be automatically removed from `hasher.getHash()`</li>
231          * <li>avoid conflicts with elements that contain ID equal to hash value;</li>
232          * </ul>
233          * @type string
234          */
235         prependHash : '/',
236         
237         /**
238          * String used to split hash paths; used by `hasher.getHashAsArray()` to split paths.
239          * <ul>
240          * <li>default value: '/';</li>
241          * </ul>
242          * @type string
243          */
244         separator : '/',
245         
246         /**
247          * Signal dispatched when hash value changes
248          * @type signals.Signal
249          */
250         changed : new Signal(),
251         
252         /**
253          * Signal dispatched when hasher is stopped
254          * @type signals.Signal
255          */
256         stopped : new Signal(),
257       
258         /**
259          * Signal dispatched when hasher is initialized
260          * @type signals.Signal
261          */
262         initialized : new Signal(),
263     
264         /**
265          * Start listening/dispatching changes in the hash/history.
266          * - hasher won't dispatch CHANGE events by manually typing a new value or pressing the back/forward buttons before calling this method.
267          */
268         init : function(){
269             if(_isActive){
270                 return;
271             }
272             
273             var oldHash = _hash;
274             _hash = _getWindowHash();
275             
276             //thought about branching/overloading hasher.init() to avoid checking multiple times but don't think worth doing it since it probably won't be called multiple times. [?] 
277             if(_isHashChangeSupported){
278                 _addListener(window, 'hashchange', _checkHistory);
279             }else { 
280                 if(_isLegacyIE){
281                     if(!_frame){
282                         _createFrame();
283                         _updateFrame(_hash);
284                     }
285                     _checkInterval = setInterval(_checkHistoryLegacyIE, 25);
286                 }else{
287                     _checkInterval = setInterval(_checkHistory, 25);
288                 }
289             }
290             
291             _isActive = true;
292             this.initialized.dispatch(_trimHash(_hash), _trimHash(oldHash));
293         },
294         
295         /**
296          * Stop listening/dispatching changes in the hash/history.
297          * - hasher won't dispatch CHANGE events by manually typing a new value or pressing the back/forward buttons after calling this method, unless you call hasher.init() again.
298          * - hasher will still dispatch changes made programatically by calling hasher.setHash();
299          */
300         stop : function(){
301             if(!_isActive){
302                 return;
303             }
304             
305             if(_isHashChangeSupported){
306                 _removeListener(window, 'hashchange', _checkHistory);
307             }else{
308                 clearInterval(_checkInterval);
309                 _checkInterval = null;
310             }
311             
312             _isActive = false;
313             this.stopped.dispatch(_trimHash(_hash), _trimHash(_hash)); //since it didn't changed oldHash and newHash should be the same. [?]
314         },
315         
316         /**
317          * Retrieve if hasher is listening to changes on the browser history and/or hash value.
318          * @return {boolean}    If hasher is listening to changes on the browser history and/or hash value.
319          */
320         isActive : function(){
321             return _isActive;
322         },
323         
324         /**
325          * Retrieve full URL.
326          * @return {string} Full URL.
327          */
328         getURL : function(){
329             return location.href;
330         },
331         
332         /**
333          * Retrieve URL without query string and hash.
334          * @return {string} Base URL.
335          */
336         getBaseURL : function(){
337             return this.getURL().replace(/(\?.*)|(\#.*)/, ''); //removes everything after '?' and/or '#'
338         },
339         
340         /**
341          * Set Hash value.
342          * @param {string} value    Hash value without '#'.
343          */
344         setHash : function(value){
345             value = (value)? this.prependHash + value.replace(/^\#/, '') + this.appendHash : value; //removes '#' from the beginning of string and append/prepend default values.
346             if(value != _hash){
347                 _registerChange(value); //avoid breaking the application if for some reason `location.hash` don't change
348                 if(_isIE && _isLocal){
349                     value = value.replace(/\?/, '%3F'); //fix IE8 local file bug [issue #6]
350                 }
351                 location.hash = '#'+ encodeURI(value); //used encodeURI instead of encodeURIComponent to preserve '?', '/', '#'. Fixes Safari bug [issue #8]
352             }
353         },
354         
355         /**
356          * Return hash value as String.
357          * @return {string} Hash value without '#'.
358          */
359         getHash : function(){
360             //didn't used actual value of the `location.hash` to avoid breaking the application in case `location.hash` isn't available and also because value should always be synched.
361             return _trimHash(_hash);
362         },
363         
364         /**
365          * Return hash value as Array.  
366          * @return {Array.<string>} Hash splitted into an Array.  
367          */
368         getHashAsArray : function(){
369             return this.getHash().split(this.separator);
370         },
371         
372         /**
373          * Set page title
374          * @param {string} value    Page Title
375          */
376         setTitle : function(value){
377             document.title = value;
378         },
379         
380         /**
381          * Get page title
382          * @return {string} Page Title
383          */
384         getTitle : function(){
385             return document.title;
386         },
387         
388         /**
389          * Navigate to previous page in history
390          */
391         back : function(){
392             history.back();
393         },
394         
395         /**
396          * Navigate to next page in history
397          */
398         forward : function(){
399             history.forward();
400         },
401         
402         /**
403          * Loads a page from the session history, identified by its relative location to the current page.
404          * - for example `-1` loads previous page, `1` loads next page.
405          * @param {Number} delta    Relative location to the current page.
406          */
407         go : function(delta){
408             history.go(delta);
409         },
410         
411         /**
412          * Removes all event listeners, stops hasher and destroy hasher object.
413          * - IMPORTANT: hasher won't work after calling this method, hasher Object will be deleted.
414          */
415         dispose : function(){
416             hasher.initialized.removeAll();
417             hasher.stopped.removeAll();
418             hasher.changed.removeAll();
419             hasher.stop();
420             _frame = hasher = window.hasher = null;
421             //can't use `delete window.hasher;` because on IE it throws errors, `window` isn't actually an object, delete can only be used on Object properties.
422         },
423         
424         /**
425          * Returns string representation of the hasher object.
426          * @return {string} A string representation of the object.
427          */
428         toString : function(){
429             return '[hasher version="'+ this.VERSION +'" hash="'+ this.getHash() +'"]';
430         }
431     
432     };
433     
434     return hasher;
435     
436 }(window || this));
437
